snippet: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.
abstract: Intertwined journeys of Troy Kastigar and Douglas McAuthur McCain, Minnesota men who died after joining Islamic militants, offer sharp example of how allure of Islamist extremism has evolved; tools of online propaganda and shadowy networks of facilitators are now drawing hundreds of Europeans and about dozen known Americans to fight with Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, Christina Capecchi from Minneapolis, and Mario Koran from San Diego.

lead_paragraph: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.

headline.main: For Jihad Recruits, a Pipeline From Minnesota to Militancy
headline.print_headline: For Jihad Recruits, a Pipeline From Minnesota to Militancy

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
